data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message:
Fix broken log & output statements.

- Address [cppcheck: coutCerrMisusage] and [-Werror=format-extra-args] errors.
- ROS_ERROR -> ROS_ERROR_NAMED.
- Print size_t values portably.

data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message:
Address [cppcheck: duplicateExpression] error.

The existing check for NaNs is in fact correct for IEEE-compliant floating
numbers, i.e., if (a == a) then a is not a NaN, but confuses static code
analyzers. This fix instead uses the isnan(a) macro from <cmath>.

data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message: Address [-Wreturn-type] warning.

data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message: Address [cppcheck: postfixOperator] warning.

data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message: Address [-Wsign-compare] warning.

data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message:
Address [cppcheck: duplicateIf] error.

The same condition was being checked twice, and the same action was being taken.

data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message:
Prevent future conflicts between STL and Boost.

mesh_filter_base.cpp was doing:

using namespace std;
using namespace boost;

Considering that Boost is a testing ground for future standard additions,
bringing the two namespaces into scope in the same translation unit is not
the best idea. In this particular file, there's a potential conflict between
C++'s and Boost's shared_ptr implementation.

data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message:
Make creation of std::pairs future-compiler-proof.

Details:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14623958/breaking-change-in-c11-with-make-pair-ty1-val1-const-ty2-val2

data.author: Adolfo Rodriguez Tsouroukdissian
data.message:
Use member NodeHandle in action clients.

Currently services and topics are already using the member NodeHandle instance,
but not the action clients.

This is relevant for two reasons:
- Consistency in the resulting ROS API namespace (everything in the same namespace).
- Consistency in the spinning policy. All services, topics and actions will be spinned
  by the same NodeHandle, and whatever custom (or not) spinners and callback queues it
  has associated.

data.author: Martin Szarski

data.author: Martin Szarski
data.message:
computeCartesianPath waypoints double-up fix

computeCartesianPath appends full trajectories between waypoints when given a vector of waypoints. As trajectories include their endpoints, this leads to the combined trajectory being generated with duplicate points at waypoints, which can lead to pauses or stuttering.

This change skips the first point in trajectories generated between waypoints.

Separate the handling of kinematics options into a separate object which

data.author: Acorn Pooley
data.message:
robot_interaction: add KinematicOptions

KinematicOptions contains the parameters needed to call RobotState::setFromIK.

KinematicOptionsMap contains a map of string->KinematicOptions a default KinematicOptions.

These are useful in RobotInteraction with the group name as the key.

data.author: Acorn Pooley
data.message:
pull RobotInteraction structures out of class

The Generic, EndEffector, and Joint structures complicate the core of
RobotInteraction.  Pull them out to simplify the code.  This will also
help with future plans to make the core of RobotInteraction more
generic and flexible.

data.author: Steve Levine
data.message:
Added support for the Translation3D-type IK

Modified the ikfast moveit template to work with OpenRAVE's
Translation3D-type IK. This is useful for manipulators with few DOF
(i.e., 3 or 4) that just want to go to a certain position without caring
so much about the end effector's orientation.

data.author: Acorn Pooley
data.message:
planning_scene_monitor: fix state update bug

The rate of state updates is limited to dt_state_update_ per second.
When an update arrived it was not processed if another was recently
processed.  This meant that if a quick sequence of state updates
arrived and then no updates arrive for a while that the last update(s)
were not seen until another arrives (which may be much later or
never). This fixes the bug by periodically checking for pending
updates and running them if they have been pending longer than
dt_state_update_.

data.author: Dave Hershberger
data.message:
Fixed doxygen function-grouping.
\defgroup was used to describe the groups of functions, but that is supposed to
group classes and files into modules.  The grouping of functions was correct in
the code and the \defgroup tags just needed to be changed to \name tags, which then
group the functions nicely within the same page.

data.author: Dave Hershberger
data.message:
Fixed doxygen function-grouping.
\defgroup was used to describe the groups of functions, but that is supposed to
group classes and files into modules.  The grouping of functions was correct in
the code and the \defgroup tags just needed to be changed to \name tags, which then
group the functions nicely within the same page.

data.author: Martin G√ºnther
data.message:
Revert "Added IKTYPE_TRANSFORM_6D definition to solve issue #5"

This reverts commit 041a914db4a6a063749c6b65946061fc6692166e. As
explained in the issue #5 comments, the #define should be inserted into
the generated code (either by the generator script or manually), *not*
set to one arbitrary value for all users. That would silently break the
generated code for all others.

distance_field: fix bug in negative propogation

erronious negative distances inside the field.  It looks like this used to
cause segfaults and was worked around by ignoring cells with invalid
negative_update_direction_.

data.author: Lucas Chiesa
data.message:
Removed some code duplication.

While working on issue #35, three functions generated the active_joints
string vector. Now it is only generated in updateTimestamps and passed
as reference to the functions that use it.

data.author: Lucas Chiesa
data.message:
Working on issue #35. No more JointTrajectory msg.

This commit should finish the transition from the previous
Joint Trajectory based timestamps calculations to making the calculations
in place in RobotTrajectory.

The new wrappers which take a JointTrajectory are still missing.

data.author: Lucas Chiesa
data.message:
More work on issue #35. Updating updateTrajectory.

Discarded the timestamps-only updateTrajectory and updated the original
one to update the time_from_previous waypoints in the RobotTrajectory
and the velocities and accelerations in every joint / waypoint.

data.author: Lucas Chiesa
data.message:
Still working on issue #35.

When updating the "updateTrajectory" function to not use
trajectory_msgs::JointTrajectory I ended up in some code that seems old
and not longer in use.  I think that velocities and accelerations
calculated in this function are not used anywhere, that's why I created
a new updateTrajectory which just updates the time between waypoints
using the previously calculated time_diff vector.

data.message:
Initial work on bug #35

Added the RobotTrajectory object to the methods that need to be
converted to test the new code against the results obtained from using
JointTrajectory.

Converted applyVelocityConstraints to use only data from the
RobotTrajectory object.

Made the JointTrajectory versions of computeTimeStamps private to ensure
that they are not used anywhere.

data.author: Acorn
data.message:
clarify comments and reorder.

Primary change is to place the "actions" in their own comment group after the methods that set the "Target".  It makes little sense to consider actions (plans and executions) until the target state has been set.

data.author: Acorn
data.message:
Add multi-collision to PlanningScene

This change removes the CollisionWorld and CollisionRobots from PlanningScene
and replaces them with an array of CollisionDetection structs.  Each
CollisionDetection contains a CollisionWorld, an unpadded CollisionRobot and a
padded CollisionRobot.  This allows several collision detection algorithms to
be easily used from the same planning scene.

data.author: Acorn
data.message:
Use World class in CollisionWorld classes

This change removes the world representation from CollisionWorld and places it into World.
This allows several CollisionWorld instances to point to the same World instance.

data.author: Acorn
data.message:
add World class

This class represents all objects in the world (everything that is not the
robot or attached to the robot).

data.author: Acorn
data.message:
disable path display when done animating

After animating the plan, turns off the plan robot display so it does not
clutter up the screen.  If trails are enabled the trails will still be
displayed.  Also fixes trails so that while animating only trails before the
current position are visible (without this the animation is not visible as it
is obscured by the trails).

Fixes issue #151

data.author: Mario Prats
data.message:
Fixes seg fault when clicking on a non-selected goal marker

When clicking, the feedback callback was called. Inside the callback, the marker was searched in the list and set to selected. This called the selectionChanged callback, where the marker gets replaced by a new one.
This is all done before the feedback callback finishes, which means the old marker signal is deleted before the callback is completed, thus leading to a seg fault. Now the selection is scheduled as a MainLoopJob, when we are sure the marker feedback callback has finished

data.message: Making a couple important changes in PlanningScene API - allowing non-const access to underlying CollisionWorld gives access that allows derived classes to get out of sync, so not allowing non-const access.  This required moving the non-const getCollisionWorld to protected and changing signature, as the compiler isn't good at figuring out which overload one is using.  Adding additional pass-throughs that make code-changes minimal

data.author: Ben Cohen
data.message:
I had a problem linking against propogation_distance_field.h because the global functions: lessThan() & equal() were declared and defined there. I kept getting multiple definition errors about each of those functions during linking. After reading through the distance_field package, I realized that the lessThan() function is never used and the equal() function is used once (right below it). So I removed the lessThan function and copied the code from the equal() function into the place where it's used.

I'm sorry for deleting them without consulting anyone (I emailed Ken A. but he didn't reply). If you need these functions back, can you just declare them in the header file and define them in the cpp file so that we can link against the distance_field package without any multiple_definition errors? Thanks.
